subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Pangram request
msgSnippet: Could you be kind enough to tell me the website of your literature in QS esp the senior script,  Also I saw Thoreau s Civil Disobedience but loss the website
messageBody:
Could you be kind enough to tell me the website of your literature in QS esp the senior script,  Also I saw Thoreau's Civil Disobedience but loss the website on that as well.  Thanking you in advance,
Sid

From: Nathan Sharfi <bonusfrogs@...>
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, May 13, 2013 8:59 AM
Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Pangram request

 
There's a longish (by the standards of Orthodox English pangrams) passage on page 11 of Read's manual; I started with that. Trying to read it multiple times should give you an idea of quickly you're improving, especially if you haven't completely forgotten the whole thing.

You could also write short notes to yourself — say, microblog-length diary entries. Wait a day or three or seven, then try to read them again. Your own language and habits of writing are much more familiar than another author's, so you're likely to be able to decode faster because you're better able to successfully predict word endings and things, saving you the time of painstakingly decoding each one.

Beyond that, there're the works that Tim Rice and I have been putting out — even if you're reading Lovecraft at a 10-minute-per-paragraph clip.

On May 12, 2013, at 5:05 PM, Sid Tanaban <sidban2@...> wrote:



I am wondering if there is a list I could copy that would help me to read Read's Alphabet
Sid
